nodes.documentation:
@author Sagar Chaurasia
@dev ERC20 interface (i have done implemantation of these function of interface in another smart contract)
nodes.name: IERC20

nodes.documentation:
@dev Wrappers over Solidity's arithmetic operations with added overflow
checks.
nodes.name: SafeMath

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the addition of two unsigned integers, reverting on
overflow.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `+` operator.
     * Requirements:
- Addition cannot overflow.
nodes.name: add

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the subtraction of two unsigned integers, reverting on
overflow (when the result is negative).
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `-` operator.
     * Requirements:
- Subtraction cannot overflow.
nodes.name: sub

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the multiplication of two unsigned integers, reverting on
overflow.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `*` operator.
     * Requirements:
- Multiplication cannot overflow.
nodes.name: mul

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the integer division of two unsigned integers. Reverts on
division by zero. The result is rounded towards zero.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `/` operator. Note: this function uses a
`revert` opcode (which leaves remaining gas untouched) while Solidity
uses an invalid opcode to revert (consuming all remaining gas).
     * Requirements:
- The divisor cannot be zero.
nodes.name: div

nodes.documentation:
@dev Returns the remainder of dividing two unsigned integers. (unsigned integer modulo),
Reverts when dividing by zero.
     * Counterpart to Solidity's `%` operator. This function uses a `revert`
opcode (which leaves remaining gas untouched) while Solidity uses an
invalid opcode to revert (consuming all remaining gas).
     * Requirements:
- The divisor cannot be zero.
nodes.name: mod

nodes.documentation:
@author Sagar Chaurasia
@dev Implementation of the `IERC20` interface.
nodes.name: ERC20

nodes.documentation:
@dev creating modifier for giving access to modules to set entity only
where set entity is contractaddress of AcuConverter
nodes.name: OnlySetEntity

nodes.documentation: @dev retunrs total number of tokens.
nodes.name: totalSupply

nodes.documentation: @dev check balance of tokens for specific entity.
nodes.name: balanceOf

nodes.documentation: @dev transfer tokens from sender to reciever.
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation:
@dev defining explicit arguments for transferring tokens
as security mesure only set entities can carry out this method
nodes.name: transferFrom

nodes.documentation: @dev Moves tokens `amount` from `sender` to `recipient`.
nodes.name: _transfer

nodes.documentation: @dev Creates `amount` tokens and assigns them to `account`, increasing
nodes.name: _mint

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: burn from the zero address"

arguments.value: ERC20: burn from the zero address

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "ERC20: burn from the zero address"

nodes.documentation: @dev Destroys `amount` tokens from `account`, reducing the
nodes.name: _burn

nodes.documentation:
@title INRToken
@author Sagar Chaurasia
nodes.name: INRToken

nodes.documentation:
Note : everything can be passed as parmeter (and same contract can be used for deploying USDT and INRT can be use ) ,
but for task understanidng and simplicity i have hardcoded gthe values here
Here , _t is the address of acuConverter

@dev Burns a specific amount of tokens.
@param value number of tokens to be burned.
nodes.name: burn

nodes.documentation: @return the name of the token.
nodes.name: name

nodes.documentation: @return the symbol of the token.
nodes.name: symbol

nodes.documentation: @return the number of decimals of the token.
nodes.name: decimals
